data.title: Korean Experience But Just OK Food
data.text:
The restaurant is small and when hou walk in the front entrance there is a large shade pulled down blocking half of the entrance. It is confusing. Once you get past.the shade you enter a large room full of many "family style" tables. 90% of the visitors are speaking Korean. So we were hopeful that we hit the Korean jack pot. However, we were disappointed. The korean vegetables (BanChan)were good. The potatoe pancake was ok. The 
Bim Bim Bap was not so good.
Overall the experience was just average. Look close by for better options.

data.title: Meat on a grand scale!
data.text: This was my first experience with Korean BBQ and it was awesome. First off, we were the only non-Koreans in the restaurant. Food was plentiful and the staff very friendly and accommodating, helping us non-Koreans how to order and cook the food.

data.title: Korean Seoul/Soul
data.text: My neighbor (a very prominent Korean healer in the South Bay) took his lovely fiancé and my husband and I out for Korean BBQ at this hidden Gardena gem.  It was very good to have insiders guide us on what to do in this first time experience.  We ordered the three meat and seafood combination and it was plenty for four people.  Then the fun began.  We all had the Korean beer (so good) and began cooking and eating in this loud and lively atmosphere.  The little bowls of Korean goodness accompanied the meal and the cabbage and green onion salad was a delight all its own.  We had so much fun and now…we believe we can come here without our BBQ spiritual guides.

data.title: Fun For a Group -Good Korean Barbeque
data.text: We enjoy coming to this restaurant for Korean food. Both the food and experience of cooking at your table are fun. The meats are well seasoned and we like the dozen or so small dishes of various vegetables and salads. We like the restaurant and will continue to come here, but there are several oddities.Parking in their lot is very tight, we have difficulty communicating with the waitresses (last night a native English speaking busboy had to explain a menu question to us) , and the odd way that food comes to you. We typically order a combination plate and always end up with too much food. It is a little strange that the soup came out near the end of the meal and we are never sure if there is more food coming. In winter we sometimes feel a draft when the door is opened.  I would not come here for a first date, but this is a fun restaurant to go to with a group.

data.title: A plethora of delicious food
data.text: I luv Korean BBQ....the assortment of salads, soups, side dishes are amazing and the cooked in front of you meats are superb.  Small place but fast service

data.title: Like being in Seoul
data.text: I have been going to this restaurant for nearly 30 years. It has gone through a couple of upgrades over that time and the current owner is fabulous. This is authentic Korean food prepared on a brazier at your table. A tremendous array of small side dishes come with the meal. You choose the marinated meat, chicken or shrimp and cook at your pace with the help of the wait staff. If you have not experienced Korean food, you will be surprised by the delicious flavors and imagination of the dishes. I served with the U.S. Army in Korea for 13 months during the mid-sixties, loved the food and searched for 20 years for a good Korean restaurant in the States until I stumbled on this SUPERIOR restaurant. Food goes great with Hite or OB (Korean beers). If you are not Asian, you may stand out as the only Westerners in the place -- a great sign of authentic food.

data.title: Expensive, Bad Service
data.text: Extremely Expensive, Not impressed with the selection of vegetables/side dishes.  Staff is slow and not very friendly.  Will never go back here.

data.title: 반찬을 비롯 모든음식이 대체적으로 단 맛이 너무 난다
data.text:
고기는 약간 단맛이 나는건 이해하는데  너무 달달하고 전반적으로 모든 반찬이 단편이다.
않그래도 설탕이 독 이라고까지 하는 요즘 음식 맛을 설탕으로 내려하는것 같다.
